description:
When they were accused of trying to overthrow the monarchy, the feared warriors the Seven Deadly Sins were sent into exile. Princess Elizabeth discovers the truth - the Sins were framed by the king's guard, the Holy Knights - too late to prevent them from assassinating her father and seizing the throne!
Now the princess is on the run, seeking the Sins to help her reclaim the kingdom. But the first Sin she meets, Meliodas, is a little innkeeper with a talking pig. He doesn't even have a real sword! Have the legends of the Sins' strength been exaggerated?

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: ศึกตำนาน 7 อัศวิน

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Spearplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of spears in combat.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Reincarnation
tags.description: Features a character being born again after death, typically as another person or in another world.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
[Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/suzukinakaba/)

Japanese manga artist who has published works in Weekly Shounen Jump, Weekly Shounen Sunday, and Weekly Shounen Magazine.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.
**Shoutarou Suga** was a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**
**Shoutarou Suga** was a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

__[Website](http://www.flow-official.jp/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLakaKEelmUdqQISLjwIRmg)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/FLOWofficial.music)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/FLOW_official)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/FLOW_OFFICIAL_JAPAN/)__

FLOW is a Japanese rock band that formed in 1998 and is signed on to Sony Music Japan's Ki/oon Records label. Flow is a five-piece band made up of two vocalists, a drummer, a bassist and a guitarist.

__Members:__
- [Keigo Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/227206/Keigo) (林圭吾) | KEIGO  - Vocalist
- [Kohshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160032) (浅川甲史) | KOHSHI - Vocalist, Occasional rhythm guitarist
- [Takeshi Asakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/160033) (浅川岳史) | TAKE  - Lead Guitarist
- Hiroshi Iwasaki | IWASAKI (岩崎博詞) - Drummer
- Yasutaro Gotou | GOT'S (後藤康太郎) - Bass

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sasakino00) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/佐々木啓悟F)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). 
Previously affiliated with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures). 
Currently affiliated with [CygamesPicture](https://anilist.co/studio/6182/CygamesPictures).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8B%A5%E6%9E%97%E5%92%8C%E5%BC%98)

**Kazuhiro Wakabayashi** is a Japanese sound director who was formerly affiliated with Techno Sound and Omnibus Promotion. After going freelance, he established his own sound production studio on May 7, 2004 called Fonishia. In 2013, he went freelance once again after his sound production studio disbanded.

__[Official Site](https://ikimonogakari.com/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCflAJoghlGeSkdz5eNIl-sg)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/IKIMONOofficial)__

__ikimono-gakari__ (いきものがかり) is a Japanese rock band. They record on Sony Music Japan's EPIC Records label.  The band was formed in Kanagawa Prefecture in February 1999 by Hotaka Yamashita and [Yoshiki Mizuno](https://anilist.co/staff/168854/Yoshiki-Mizuno), and was later joined by lead vocalist [Kiyoe Yoshioka](https://anilist.co/staff/159004) in December the same year. Hotaka Yamashita later left the band as of July 2021.

node.description:
[Website](https://www.mwamjapan.info) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mwamofficial) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/MWAMofficial) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mwamofficial/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/MWAMjapan)

__Introduction:__
Man with a Mission, stylized as MAN WITH A MISSION or sometimes as MWAM is a Japanese rock band which was formed in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan in 2010. This band currently consists five band members, with stage names of Tokyo Tanaka, Jean-Ken Johnny, Kamikaze Boy, DJ Santa Monica and Spear Rib.

MWAM's music style has been described as hard rock and dance rock. Their distinguishing feature is that all of the members wear differently designed wolf masks during both their concerts and their music videos. Many of their singles have been used as theme songs for a variety of anime, live-action movies, and video games.

__Biography:__
Before becoming popular, the band invented a back-story for why they wear wolf masks, which involves them being created as the "Ultimate Life Form" by [Jimi Hendrix](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jimi_Hendrix), who is described by the band as being the doctor of the guitar and master wolf biologist. They were then frozen in Antarctica for years. While they were frozen, they had been listening to all kinds of music from all around the world, before later escaping and emerging onto the Japanese music scene.

The earliest debut of the band was in a number of live gigs at venues in the Shibuya area. The band organized an American tour in late 2010, which was called their "[Whisky a Go Go](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whisky_a_Go_Go)" tour and involved multiple gigs at night clubs in Los Angeles. The tour itself ended in November 2010. The end of their tour coincided with the release of their first mini album, ___Welcome to the New World___, in November as well, which went on to sell out in a number of stores across Japan. The mini album also spent six weeks on the [Oricon Top 100](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oricon) for number of sales. On April 29, 2011, they released a new single titled "Never Fxxkin' Mind the Rules". After the single release, the band started another music tour on March 7, 2011, called "Man with a Mission Japan Marking Tour 2011", which included 13 different performances across Japan. Their first full debut album, ___Man with a Mission___, released on June 8, 2011.

Soon after the release of their album, they participated in a major Japanese concert event, known as "[Summer Sonic 2011](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Sonic_Festival)" in mid-August, and also a number of other summer festivals, such as "Countdown Japan 11/12". Labeled by ___Eggman Magazine___ as the "Most Promising Newcomer", tickets to their show at the concert festival sold out within ten minutes. During the stream of concerts, their songs were also run on 27 of the major FM and AM radio broadcasting stations nationwide across Japan. On October 5, 2011, the band released an EP titled ___Trick or Treat___, which included a number of original songs and also cover songs, such as "[Smells Like Teen Spirit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smells_Like_Teen_Spirit)" by [Nirvana](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nirvana_(band)). The members of Man with a Mission were also featured in a poster campaign by [Tower Records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tower_Records) titled "___No Music, No Life?___", which began on September 13, 2011.

Continuation of biography here: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_with_a_Mission)

___Members:___
- Tokyo Tanaka (トーキョー・タナカ) - vocals, leader
- [Jean-Ken Johnny](https://anilist.co/staff/149135/JeanKen-Johnny) (ジャン・ケン・ジョニー) - guitar, vocals, rap
- [Kamikaze Boy](https://anilist.co/staff/149139/Kamikaze-Boy) (カミカゼ・ボーイ) - bass guitar, backing vocals
- DJ Santa Monica (DJサンタモニカ) - DJ, sampling
- Spear Rib (スペア・リブ) - drums

(Sources: [en.wikipedia.org](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man_with_a_Mission) | [ja.wikipedia.org](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/MAN_WITH_A_MISSION) | [mwamjapan.info](https://www.mwamjapan.info/profiles))

Website | Twitter | Facebook | Artist page (lantis) Introduction Granrodeo (stylized as GRANRODEO, and also known as KISHOW x e-Zuka) is a Japanese rock band, specializing in creating anime soundtracks. They are currently under the record label Lantis (2005-2009, 2012-), while previously having been under GloryHeaven (2009-2012) Biography In 2005 voice actor Kishō Taniyama ("Kishow") and musician Masaaki Iizuka ("E-Zuka"), known for his collaborations in creating anime soundtracks, decided to create a new project. During their years as a band, they released a few singles that were used as opening singles for the anime series. In 2007 they released their first album, Ride on the Edge, and in 2008 they release a second album, Instinct. In spring 2009 they started working on the soundtrack, the series Needless, for which E-Zuka wrote the soundtracks and Kishow wrote the lyrics for the song "Modern Strange Cowboy". By the end of 2009, they released their third album, Brush the Scar Lemon. In 2011 they released their fourth album, Supernova, and in 2012 they released their fifth album Crack Star Flash. Granrodeo covered "Tell Me" for the June 6, 2018 hide tribute album Tribute Impulse. Members Kishou Taniyama (谷山紀章/Kishow) - vocals, lyrics. (2005-) According to him, the role of a vocalist is more suitable for him than the role of a voice actor. Masaaki Iizuka (飯塚昌明/E-Zuka) - Guitar, composer, arranging. (2005-) His style of playing the guitar combines melodic solo parts and aggressive guitar riffs. He also collaborates with Minami Kuribayashi. (Source: en.wikipedia.org)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._
